actions.committee: House Committee on the District of Columbia
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the District of Columbia.
Reported to House from the Committee on the District of Columbia with amendment, H. Rept. 96-1365.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #590 (251-140).
Referred to Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs.

official_title: A bill to amend the National Capital Transportation Act of 1969 to require the Secretary of Transportation to contract with the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority for a comprehensive study of extending the rail rapid transit line specified in the Adopted Regional System.

summary.text: (Measure passed House, amended, roll call #590 (251-140)) Amends the National Capital Transportation Act of 1969 to require the Secretary of Transportation to contract with the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority for a comprehensive study of extending rail rapid transit lines specified in the Adopted Regional System and within the District of Columbia. Requires such study to take into consideration estimated demand for each proposed rail rapid transit line extension, projected population growth along each proposed extension, and the engineering feasibility of each proposed extension. Requires the Transit Authority to submit to the Secretary and the Congress, a report, within six months after the date of contract is entered into, on that part of the study on the feasibility of extending a rail rapid transit line to the Dulles International Airport, and a report, within 18 months after the date the contract is entered into, on the entire study, containing proposed routes for each proposed rail rapid transit line extension. Requires such contract to provide for a Federal contribution, not to exceed 80 percent and to be paid by the Secretary to the Transit Authority, to pay for the costs of the contract.

titles.title: A bill to amend the National Capital Transportation Act of 1969 to require the Secretary of Transportation to contract with the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority for a comprehensive study of extending the rail rapid transit line specified in the Adopted Regional System.
